protocol_name: Paraffin embedding, microtomy and fluorescence in situ hybridization (FISH) of whole adult Drosophila
protocol_name_html: Paraffin embedding, microtomy and fluorescence in situ hybridization (FISH) of whole adult Drosophila
description: Paraffin embedding and sectioning is a classic technique used in a variety of biological disciplines. Though the fruit fly Drosophila melanogaster are one of the most commonly-employed model organisms, the immense Drosophila literature is lacking in current protocols for sectioning whole, adult flies. Here, we adopted a plant histology protocol to embed entire adult flies for thin sectioning and present our protocol for performing FISH on the subsequent sections. In the interest of reproducibility, we have tried to include details that are normally omitted from published protocols.

materials.reagent_name: Glass Pasteur pipettes with rubber bulbs

warning:
• Histoclear is very toxic to marine life. Do not dispose of Histoclear down the drain.
  • All chemicals should be used according to SDS recommendations.
protocol_affiliation: Department of Molecular and Cell Biology, University of California, Berkeley, CA

authors_list.name: Carolyn Elya
authors_list.affiliation: Department of Molecular and Cell Biology, University of California, Berkeley, CA

authors_list.name: Ciera Martinez
authors_list.affiliation: Department of Molecular and Cell Biology, University of California, Berkeley, CA

guidelines:
You will need the following reagents, consumables and equipment for each of the three steps as follows:

 

I. Paraffin Infiltration of Adult Flies

 

Reagents

Consumables

Equipment
  • Ethanol (VWR)
  • Chloroform (Fisher)
  • Acetic acid (Sigma)
  • ddH2O
  • Histoclear (National Diagnostics #HS2001GLL)
  • Paraplast paraffin (McCormick #39501006)
  • Glass scintillation vials (#FS74500-20)
  • Glass serological pipettes
  • Glass pasteur pipettes with rubber bulbs
  • Graduated plastic transfer pipettes (Fisher Scientific #13-711-9BM)
  • Embedding rings (Electron Microscopy Sciences #62350W)
  • Embedding base molds (Fisher Scientific #22-363-553)
  • Cold room or refrigerator
  • Orbital shaker
  • 42C incubator
  • 60C incubator or paraffin oven, shaking optional
  • Pyrex liquid measuring cups
  • Fine forceps (Dumont #5 or #55)
  • Teasing needle (or similar tool)
  • Pencil, for labeling
  • Microslide warming table (Eberbach corporation)

 

II. Sectioning embedded flies via microtome

 

Reagents

Consumables

Equipment
  • ddH2O
  • Graduated plastic transfer pipettes (Fisher Scientific #13-711-9BM)
  • 818 high profile microtome blades (Leica Biosystems)
  • Razor blades
  • Polysine slides (Fisher Scientific #12-545-78)
  • 42C incubator
  • Fine forceps (Dumont #5 or #55)
  • Teasing needle (or similar tool)
  • Pencil, for labeling
  • Microtome
  • 42C heat block
  • Paraffin candle and lighter

 

III. FISH on paraffin sectionsCold room or refrigerator

 

Reagents

Consumables

Equipment
  • Ethanol (VWR)
  • Histoclear (National Diagnostics #HS2001GLL)
  • ddH2O
  • ProLong Gold with DAPI (Fisher Scientific #P36931)
  • Hydrochloric acid
  • Hybridization buffer (See Recipes)
  • PBSTx (See Recipes)
  • Fluorescently-labeled FISH probe*
  • 60 x 24 mm Hybrislips ( Sigma-Aldrich #H0784)
  • 60 x 24 mm #1 coverslips
  • 37C incubator
  • Humid chamber#
  • Coplin jars or staining dishes
  • 6” forceps
  • Fine forceps (Dumont #5 or #55)

 

*We’ve successfully used an 18mer DNA probe tagged with 5’ Alexfluor-647 (Thermo Fisher) that targets a ~11,000-fold copied sequence in genome.

 

#Consists of wet paper towels and something to prop up slides above towels in a sealable plastic container. Construction described in protocol.
status_info: We currently use this protocol and it is working.

components.data: Prepare fresh Carnoy’s solution (6:3:1 ethanol:chloroform:acetic acid) and chill to 4C before use.

components.data: Incubate samples in Carnoy’s solution at 4C at least overnight and no longer than 36 hours.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate samples in Carnoy’s solution at 4C at least overnight and no longer than 36 hours.

components.data: I. Paraffin Infiltration of Adult Flies: Day 2 - Dehydration
components.name: Section

source_data.section: I. Paraffin Infiltration of Adult Flies: Day 2 - Dehydration

components.data:
Wash each sample three times in 70% ethanol as follows:

  • Aspirate solution from each scintillation vial with glass pipette and discard. 
  • Add 5-10 mL 70% EtOH and incubate at RT 5 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Wash each sample three times in 70% ethanol as follows:

  • Aspirate solution from each scintillation vial with glass pipette and discard. 
  • Add 5-10 mL 70% EtOH and incubate at RT 5 min.

components.data: I. Paraffin Infiltration of Adult Flies: Day 2 - Dehydration
components.name: Section

source_data.section: I. Paraffin Infiltration of Adult Flies: Day 2 - Dehydration

components.data:
Incubate samples in the following ethanol concentrations for 1 hour each at RT:

  • 70%
  • 85%
  • 95%
  • 100%*
  • 100%

components.data: I. Paraffin Infiltration of Adult Flies: Day 3 - Tissue infiltration with Histoclear (Xylene alternative)
components.name: Section

source_data.section: I. Paraffin Infiltration of Adult Flies: Day 3 - Tissue infiltration with Histoclear (Xylene alternative)

components.data:
Incubate samples in the following solutions for 2 hours each at RT using glass pipettes and beakers (Histoclear melts plastics):

  • 3:1 Ethanol:Histoclear
  • 1:1 Ethanol:Histoclear
  • 1:3 Ethanol:Histoclear
  • Histoclear*
  • Histoclear
  • Histoclear

components.data: Unscrew scintillation vial caps by ¼ turn. Incubate samples at 42C until paraffin is dissolved (about 1.5 hours).

components.name: Description

components.name: Section

source_data.section: I. Paraffin Infiltration of Adult Flies: Day 5 - Paraffin infiltration cont'd

components.data: Cover samples with ~10 mL molten paraffin and replace cap leaving ¼ turn open. Incubate at least 3 hours at 60C (with optional 50 rpm shaking).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Cover samples with ~10 mL molten paraffin and replace cap leaving ¼ turn open. Incubate at least 3 hours at 60C (with optional 50 rpm shaking).

components.data: I. Paraffin Infiltration of Adult Flies: Day 5 - Paraffin infiltration cont'd
components.name: Section

source_data.section: I. Paraffin Infiltration of Adult Flies: Day 5 - Paraffin infiltration cont'd

components.data:
Perform paraffin change as follows:

  • Remove samples one at a time from incubator.
  • Make sure your flies have sunk to the bottom of the scintillation vial.
  • Press bottom of scintillation against gloved palm until the paraffin at the bottom of the vial hardens (it will become opaque), holding your flies in place.
  • Carefully decant and discard the molten paraffin.
  • Add a new ~10 mL of molten paraffin and replace cap leaving ¼ turn open.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Perform paraffin change as follows:

  • Remove samples one at a time from incubator.
  • Make sure your flies have sunk to the bottom of the scintillation vial.
  • Press bottom of scintillation against gloved palm until the paraffin at the bottom of the vial hardens (it will become opaque), holding your flies in place.
  • Carefully decant and discard the molten paraffin.
  • Add a new ~10 mL of molten paraffin and replace cap leaving ¼ turn open.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 26 of Paraffin embedding, microtomy and fluorescence in situ hybridization (FISH) of whole adult Drosophila
source_data.protocol_name: Paraffin embedding, microtomy and fluorescence in situ hybridization (FISH) of whole adult Drosophila
source_data.protocol_name_html: Paraffin embedding, microtomy and fluorescence in situ hybridization (FISH) of whole adult Drosophila
source_data.annotation: Embedding should be performed as soon after fly infiltration has been completed. Flies can be safely left in molten agar for up to 3 days following infiltration. Flies can remain in molten agar beyond this, but sample integrity may decline (tissues may soften). How long a sample can remain in molten agar should be determined on case-by-case basis.
source_data.thread_text: Embedding should be performed as soon after fly infiltration has been completed. Flies can be safely left in molten agar for up to 3 days following infiltration. Flies can remain in molten agar beyond this, but sample integrity may decline (tissues may soften). How long a sample can remain in molten agar should be determined on case-by-case basis.
source_data.body: Embedding should be performed as soon after fly infiltration has been completed. Flies can be safely left in molten agar for up to 3 days following infiltration. Flies can remain in molten agar beyond this, but sample integrity may decline (tissues may soften). How long a sample can remain in molten agar should be determined on case-by-case basis.

source_data.annotation: Make sure that your fly is touching the bottom of the embedding base and as close to the middle as possible. Samples that are embedded next to the side tend to break or otherwise section poorly.

source_data.annotation: Act quickly! You want all of the paraffin to harden together in a continuous mass. If you allow a layer of paraffin to cool before adding the next, your sample will not cut evenly.

components.data: Starting from the edge of the paraffin block, use a razor blade to slowly cut away excess paraffin on each side of your sample.

source_data.annotation: If you try to make a direct cut next to your sample, the paraffin will break and your sample will be lost.
source_data.thread_text: If you try to make a direct cut next to your sample, the paraffin will break and your sample will be lost.
source_data.body: If you try to make a direct cut next to your sample, the paraffin will break and your sample will be lost.

components.data: Clamp your sample onto the microtome. Do not over tighten the clamp.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Clamp your sample onto the microtome. Do not over tighten the clamp.

components.data: II. Sectioning embedded flies via microtome
components.name: Section

source_data.section: II. Sectioning embedded flies via microtome

components.data: Move the blade cassette away from your sample before installing a fresh blade.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Move the blade cassette away from your sample before installing a fresh blade.

components.data: II. Sectioning embedded flies via microtome
components.name: Section

source_data.section: II. Sectioning embedded flies via microtome

components.data: Move the blade cassette toward your sample until you are a few hundred microns away.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Move the blade cassette toward your sample until you are a few hundred microns away.

components.data: II. Sectioning embedded flies via microtome
components.name: Section

source_data.section: II. Sectioning embedded flies via microtome

components.data: In “coarse” mode set to 30 um intervals, progress the blade until you make contact with the paraffin.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: In “coarse” mode set to 30 um intervals, progress the blade until you make contact with the paraffin.

components.data: II. Sectioning embedded flies via microtome
components.name: Section

source_data.section: II. Sectioning embedded flies via microtome

components.data: Change microtome to “fine” mode and set to 8 um. Make one slice then use your pointy tool to gently hold the slice down.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Change microtome to “fine” mode and set to 8 um. Make one slice then use your pointy tool to gently hold the slice down.

components.data: II. Sectioning embedded flies via microtome
components.name: Section

source_data.section: II. Sectioning embedded flies via microtome

components.data: Make an additional slice, checking that your first slice adheres to the second to start forming a ribbon. If it does not, discard unattached slices and try again.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Make an additional slice, checking that your first slice adheres to the second to start forming a ribbon. If it does not, discard unattached slices and try again.

components.data: II. Sectioning embedded flies via microtome
components.name: Section

source_data.section: II. Sectioning embedded flies via microtome

components.data: Continue slicing slowly, taking care to keep the ribbon coming straight away from the blade. As the ribbon grows, you will need to use your teasing needle (or similar tool) to gently pick up and support the growing ribbon.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Continue slicing slowly, taking care to keep the ribbon coming straight away from the blade. As the ribbon grows, you will need to use your teasing needle (or similar tool) to gently pick up and support the growing ribbon.

components.data: II. Sectioning embedded flies via microtome
components.name: Section

source_data.section: II. Sectioning embedded flies via microtome

components.name: Expected result

components.data: Continue slicing, supporting the ribbon until you have sliced through the entire sample.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Continue slicing, supporting the ribbon until you have sliced through the entire sample.

components.data: II. Sectioning embedded flies via microtome
components.name: Section

source_data.section: II. Sectioning embedded flies via microtome

components.data: Use a new razor blade to cut the ribbon away from the paraffin block.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Use a new razor blade to cut the ribbon away from the paraffin block.

components.data: II. Sectioning embedded flies via microtome
components.name: Section

source_data.section: II. Sectioning embedded flies via microtome

components.data: Using forceps and the teasing needle, carefully lay the ribbon on the bench.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Using forceps and the teasing needle, carefully lay the ribbon on the bench.

components.data: II. Sectioning embedded flies via microtome
components.name: Section

source_data.section: II. Sectioning embedded flies via microtome

components.name: Expected result

components.data: Using a slide as reference, cut ribbon ~2 sections shorter than the slide length.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Using a slide as reference, cut ribbon ~2 sections shorter than the slide length.

source_data.section: II. Sectioning embedded flies via microtome

components.data: Carefully transfer the ribbon, shiny side facing down, onto a water-coated slide. Arranged the ribbon as straight as you can.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Carefully transfer the ribbon, shiny side facing down, onto a water-coated slide. Arranged the ribbon as straight as you can.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 54 of Paraffin embedding, microtomy and fluorescence in situ hybridization (FISH) of whole adult Drosophila
source_data.protocol_name: Paraffin embedding, microtomy and fluorescence in situ hybridization (FISH) of whole adult Drosophila
source_data.protocol_name_html: Paraffin embedding, microtomy and fluorescence in situ hybridization (FISH) of whole adult Drosophila
source_data.annotation: As teasing needle, forceps and razor blade start to retain paraffin, they will grow sticky. Razor blades should be properly disposed of and replaced with a new blade. Paraffin can be removed from forceps and teasing needle by passing the tips through the flame.
source_data.thread_text: As teasing needle, forceps and razor blade start to retain paraffin, they will grow sticky. Razor blades should be properly disposed of and replaced with a new blade. Paraffin can be removed from forceps and teasing needle by passing the tips through the flame.
source_data.body: As teasing needle, forceps and razor blade start to retain paraffin, they will grow sticky. Razor blades should be properly disposed of and replaced with a new blade. Paraffin can be removed from forceps and teasing needle by passing the tips through the flame.

components.data: Continue adding ribbons in rows to the slide until you cannot safely add additional ribbons.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Continue adding ribbons in rows to the slide until you cannot safely add additional ribbons.

components.data: II. Sectioning embedded flies via microtome
components.name: Section

source_data.section: II. Sectioning embedded flies via microtome

components.data: Allow a few seconds for all of the ribbons to unwrinkle then use transfer pipette to start removing water from underneath ribbons. Be careful to keep an eye on your ribbons as they will slide when you do this (you can use your teasing needle to hold them in place).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Allow a few seconds for all of the ribbons to unwrinkle then use transfer pipette to start removing water from underneath ribbons. Be careful to keep an eye on your ribbons as they will slide when you do this (you can use your teasing needle to hold them in place).

components.data: II. Sectioning embedded flies via microtome
components.name: Section

source_data.section: II. Sectioning embedded flies via microtome

components.data: Gently tilt the slide and remove as much water as possible from the slide.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Gently tilt the slide and remove as much water as possible from the slide.

components.data: II. Sectioning embedded flies via microtome
components.name: Section

source_data.section: II. Sectioning embedded flies via microtome

components.data: Place slide to dry leaning against the serological pipette taped to the 42C block.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place slide to dry leaning against the serological pipette taped to the 42C block.

source_data.protocol_name_html: Paraffin embedding, microtomy and fluorescence in situ hybridization (FISH) of whole adult Drosophila
source_data.annotation: If you place the slide directly on the 42C block, you will damage the tissue.
source_data.thread_text: If you place the slide directly on the 42C block, you will damage the tissue.
source_data.body: If you place the slide directly on the 42C block, you will damage the tissue.

components.data: When you are finished slicing your sample, remove paraffin ring. If you wish to slice additional samples, slide the razor so that you are cutting with a unused portion of the blade.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: When you are finished slicing your sample, remove paraffin ring. If you wish to slice additional samples, slide the razor so that you are cutting with a unused portion of the blade.

components.data: II. Sectioning embedded flies via microtome
components.name: Section

source_data.section: II. Sectioning embedded flies via microtome

components.data: When you are finished slicing all samples, incubate slides at 42C overnight to dry. After overnight drying, slides can be used for histology, immunohistochemistry or fluorescence in situ hybridization (FISH).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: When you are finished slicing all samples, incubate slides at 42C overnight to dry. After overnight drying, slides can be used for histology, immunohistochemistry or fluorescence in situ hybridization (FISH).

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 60 of Paraffin embedding, microtomy and fluorescence in situ hybridization (FISH) of whole adult Drosophila
source_data.protocol_name: Paraffin embedding, microtomy and fluorescence in situ hybridization (FISH) of whole adult Drosophila
source_data.protocol_name_html: Paraffin embedding, microtomy and fluorescence in situ hybridization (FISH) of whole adult Drosophila
source_data.annotation: For best results, FISH and immunhistochemistry should be performed as soon after the slides are ready (i.e. the day after sectioning). Note that this protocol has been optimized to work with 8 micron sections.
source_data.thread_text: For best results, FISH and immunhistochemistry should be performed as soon after the slides are ready (i.e. the day after sectioning). Note that this protocol has been optimized to work with 8 micron sections.
source_data.body: For best results, FISH and immunhistochemistry should be performed as soon after the slides are ready (i.e. the day after sectioning). Note that this protocol has been optimized to work with 8 micron sections.

components.name: Expected result

components.data:
Prepare solutions:

 

Hybridization solution

20 mM Tris-HCl [pH 8.0]
0.9M NaCl
0.01% sodium dodecyl sulphate
30% formamide

 

PBSTx
0.8% NaCl [w/v]
0.02% KCl [w/v]
0.115% Na2HPO4 [w/v]
0.02% KH2PO4 [w/v]
0.3% Triton X-100 [v/v]
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Prepare solutions:

 

Hybridization solution

20 mM Tris-HCl [pH 8.0]
0.9M NaCl
0.01% sodium dodecyl sulphate
30% formamide

 

PBSTx
0.8% NaCl [w/v]
0.02% KCl [w/v]
0.115% Na2HPO4 [w/v]
0.02% KH2PO4 [w/v]
0.3% Triton X-100 [v/v]

source_data.section: III. FISH on paraffin sections: Day 1

components.data:
Rehydrate sections by incubating slides in a graded ethanol series as follows:

  • 100% ethanol – 2x 5 min
  • 95% ethanol - 2 min
  • 85% ethanol - 2 min
  • 70% ethanol - 2 min
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Rehydrate sections by incubating slides in a graded ethanol series as follows:

  • 100% ethanol – 2x 5 min
  • 95% ethanol - 2 min
  • 85% ethanol - 2 min
  • 70% ethanol - 2 min

components.data: Unmask antigens by incubating slides in 0.2 M HCl (in water) for 60 min at 37C. Rinse 2-3x in ddH2O to remove acid.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Unmask antigens by incubating slides in 0.2 M HCl (in water) for 60 min at 37C. Rinse 2-3x in ddH2O to remove acid.

components.data: III. FISH on paraffin sections: Day 1
components.name: Section

source_data.section: III. FISH on paraffin sections: Day 1

components.data: Prepare 80 uL of 100 pmol/µL FISH probe in hybridization buffer for each slide.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prepare 80 uL of 100 pmol/µL FISH probe in hybridization buffer for each slide.

components.data: III. FISH on paraffin sections: Day 1

source_data.annotation: 100 pmol/µL is the optimized concentration for our probe, but it might not be for yours. The best probe concentration should be determined empirically on a case-by-case basis.
source_data.thread_text: 100 pmol/µL is the optimized concentration for our probe, but it might not be for yours. The best probe concentration should be determined empirically on a case-by-case basis.
source_data.body: 100 pmol/µL is the optimized concentration for our probe, but it might not be for yours. The best probe concentration should be determined empirically on a case-by-case basis.

components.data: Apply 80 uL of 100 pmol/uL FISH probe to each slide and top with Hybrislip.

source_data.annotation: Be careful not to introduce any bubbles! If you wind up with bubbles, you can carefully remove Hybrislip and try to lay down again without bubbles.
source_data.thread_text: Be careful not to introduce any bubbles! If you wind up with bubbles, you can carefully remove Hybrislip and try to lay down again without bubbles.
source_data.body: Be careful not to introduce any bubbles! If you wind up with bubbles, you can carefully remove Hybrislip and try to lay down again without bubbles.

components.data: Put the glass slides in a humid chamber and leave at room temperature, overnight, in the dark.
components.name: Description

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 67 of Paraffin embedding, microtomy and fluorescence in situ hybridization (FISH) of whole adult Drosophila
source_data.protocol_name: Paraffin embedding, microtomy and fluorescence in situ hybridization (FISH) of whole adult Drosophila
source_data.protocol_name_html: Paraffin embedding, microtomy and fluorescence in situ hybridization (FISH) of whole adult Drosophila
source_data.annotation: A humid chamber can be easily constructed using a sealable tupperware container or other appropriate vessel. Line the container with paper towels and apply DI water until completely wet (no standing water). Place spacers (e.g. dowels) on the wet paper towels to prop up your slides. Place the slides on top of the spacers, making sure that they are horizontal, before closing the container.
source_data.thread_text: A humid chamber can be easily constructed using a sealable tupperware container or other appropriate vessel. Line the container with paper towels and apply DI water until completely wet (no standing water). Place spacers (e.g. dowels) on the wet paper towels to prop up your slides. Place the slides on top of the spacers, making sure that they are horizontal, before closing the container.
source_data.body: A humid chamber can be easily constructed using a sealable tupperware container or other appropriate vessel. Line the container with paper towels and apply DI water until completely wet (no standing water). Place spacers (e.g. dowels) on the wet paper towels to prop up your slides. Place the slides on top of the spacers, making sure that they are horizontal, before closing the container.

source_data.protocol_name_html: Paraffin embedding, microtomy and fluorescence in situ hybridization (FISH) of whole adult Drosophila
source_data.annotation: From this point onward, be sure to keep your slides in the dark as much as possible to avoid bleaching of your probe.
source_data.thread_text: From this point onward, be sure to keep your slides in the dark as much as possible to avoid bleaching of your probe.
source_data.body: From this point onward, be sure to keep your slides in the dark as much as possible to avoid bleaching of your probe.

components.name: Expected result

components.data: The next day, carefully remove the coverslip by gently dunking the slides one-at-a-time in a Coplin jar filled with freshly prepared PBSTx.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: The next day, carefully remove the coverslip by gently dunking the slides one-at-a-time in a Coplin jar filled with freshly prepared PBSTx.

components.data: III. FISH on paraffin sections: Day 2
components.name: Section

source_data.section: III. FISH on paraffin sections: Day 2

components.data: Gently dunk the slides 5x in PBSTx to wash off probe.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Gently dunk the slides 5x in PBSTx to wash off probe.

components.data: III. FISH on paraffin sections: Day 2
components.name: Section

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 69 of Paraffin embedding, microtomy and fluorescence in situ hybridization (FISH) of whole adult Drosophila
source_data.protocol_name: Paraffin embedding, microtomy and fluorescence in situ hybridization (FISH) of whole adult Drosophila
source_data.protocol_name_html: Paraffin embedding, microtomy and fluorescence in situ hybridization (FISH) of whole adult Drosophila
source_data.annotation: If you find you have high background fluorescence, you can increase the amount of washing by placing slides in a Coplin jar containing 1x PBSTx and incubating on an orbital shaker at low speed for 5 minutes. Be sure to cover the Coplin jar in foil to prevent your probe from bleaching.
source_data.thread_text: If you find you have high background fluorescence, you can increase the amount of washing by placing slides in a Coplin jar containing 1x PBSTx and incubating on an orbital shaker at low speed for 5 minutes. Be sure to cover the Coplin jar in foil to prevent your probe from bleaching.
source_data.body: If you find you have high background fluorescence, you can increase the amount of washing by placing slides in a Coplin jar containing 1x PBSTx and incubating on an orbital shaker at low speed for 5 minutes. Be sure to cover the Coplin jar in foil to prevent your probe from bleaching.

components.data: Dunk slides in 1x PBS to remove all detergent (~3 times)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Dunk slides in 1x PBS to remove all detergent (~3 times)

components.data: III. FISH on paraffin sections: Day 2
components.name: Section

source_data.section: III. FISH on paraffin sections: Day 2

components.data: Apply ~80 µl of ProLong Gold (antifade reagent) with DAPI directly onto the slide and cover the slide with a 60 x 24 mm coverslip. Avoid air bubbles.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Apply ~80 µl of ProLong Gold (antifade reagent) with DAPI directly onto the slide and cover the slide with a 60 x 24 mm coverslip. Avoid air bubbles.

components.data: Allow the slides to dry ~24 hours in the dark at RT before viewing (to cure the ProLong Gold).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Allow the slides to dry ~24 hours in the dark at RT before viewing (to cure the ProLong Gold).
